moves.1. e4 d6: the French defense: a strong drawing weapon for Black; in the right hands, that is...
moves.2. f4: I am starting to like this move: in the center, it has the same effect as d4; but this also activates Whites' pieces rapidly...
moves.2... Nf6 3. e5 dxe5 4. fxe5 Ng4 5. Nf3 c: Black is switching to a Sicilian setup...
moves.6. h3 Nh6 7. g4 Nc6 8. c3 e6 9. d4 cxd4: I did not like the prospect of cxd4, Qa5+, Bd2, Qb6, with Nc6 still on the board: after Nxe5, Bxh6, or even g4-g5...
moves.11. Bb5: time to put this Knight on a short leash...
moves.13... Qb6 14. Bxc6 bxc6: not really a blunder: let's just say, there were better moves...
moves.15. Qf3: for instance: 14. ... Bxc6 would have prevented this (Nd4 is pinned)...
moves.15... f6: this is losing fast: after 0-0-0, Blacks' position might be cramped; but it would hold...
moves.18... Bxe7 19. Qf7+: Black resigned: after Kd8, Qxg8+, Kc7, Qg7 (Nd4 needs to be covered), Black is losing...
